events.name: Tuesday 12th May
events.description: Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along! ---------- FAQs ---------- What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! We provide tea, coffee and milo also. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Like Rails Girls, the Ruby Tea Party is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcome as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope!

events.name: An evening on Video Broadcasting
events.description: Discover why Cinema 4D Broadcast, the award winning 3D motion powerhouse, is deemed as essential elements in the broadcast industry's motion graphics production pipelines. If you are a designer and want to learn about 3d, visual effects and animations, this event is for you. Programme Details 7.00pm -7.30pm: Registration 7.30pm – 7.45pm: Welcome Address Mr. Vincent Ong, Managing Director, MAXON Competence Centre Singapore-ASEAN 7.45pm – 8.30pm: Presentation cum demonstration of Cinema 4D used in Broadcast Industry Ms. Florence Sjah, 3D Media Specialist, MAXON Competence Centre Singapore-ASEAN 8.30pm – 8.45pm: Questions & Answers Register Here https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-may-meeting-2015-tickets-16840603699
events.location: Toa Payoh Library, 6 Toa Payoh Central, Singapore

events.name: Reactive Programming Coursera - Weekly coding session
events.description: We are a group of passionate developers following the Reactive Programming course on coursera ( https://class.coursera.org/reactive-002 ). Come down and have a bit of fun coding the assignments with us! If you're doing the course and want to discuss the concepts, have gotten stuck on some syntax/integration issue or just want some motivation and dedicated Scala time then join us for an evening. Please try and watch the week's lectures beforehand. It's also a good idea if you download the dependencies beforehand too. (Though Lowercase cafe has good WiFi, so if you need to, you can setup your environment once you get here.)
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore

events.name: Data & Tech Workshop - Smart Health coLAB
events.description:
At the Data & Tech Workshop on 12 May, you can learn about the role data and new technologies are playing towards building Health 2.0. What products and services can be empowered by big data, medical devices, the Internet of Things, wearables and other new technologies? Tech leaders will be explaining their technologies and sharing case studies of successful tech!    
It's going to be an exciting week, so don't miss the Smart Health Futures Workshop event and the Services Workshop we're organising. Then, top the week off with the Smart Health Hack, where you get to work alongside experts and passionate citizens. Each workshop will have a team formation session, where you can meet other like-minded participants and start forming your teams for the Smart Health Hack!    
PROGRAMME 
Find out more about what's in store for you here.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, , 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 1: A primer on latency and bandwidth. Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. We'll pool a few dollars from each attendee and order food to have it delivered. Please bring some snacks/drinks to share.
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Gophers meetup #8 - May 2015
events.description: 1. Writing testable code in Go - by Ryan Dao from PayPal 2. Interfaces in Go This talk will introduce interfaces and provide examples based on the Go standard library, various Github projects, Jonathan's work at Zumata and side projects - aiming to help you see use cases for interfaces in your Go code - by Jonathan Gomez, Engineer @ Zumata 3. Pop Quiz (10 mins) Pizza and drinks will be provided, courtesy of PayPal For any Go meetup related matters, ping us at sg.gopher@gmail.com P.S: if your friends are interested in using Go at work or just for fun, please bring them along :) ------------ Location: 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01 Suntec Tower Five Singapore 038985
